docs.lead_paragraph: As we’ve noted here before, the federal disability program cost about $190 billion last year, in payments to disabled workers and health care for them. That’s the equivalent of roughly $1,500 in taxes for every American household.
docs.abstract: A West Virginia judge has an approval rate in disability cases unlike any other, highlighting the problems with the program.
docs.snippet: A West Virginia judge has an approval rate in disability cases unlike any other, highlighting the problems with the program.

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal officials announced new rules on Thursday that require health insurers that decide to raise their rates sharply to provide more justification for the higher premiums.

headline.main: Double-Digit Insurance Rate Increases Get More Scrutiny

docs.abstract: The Department of Health and Human Services wants insurers to give detailed explanations for raising premiums.
docs.snippet: The Department of Health and Human Services wants insurers to give detailed explanations for raising premiums.

docs.lead_paragraph: Every Friday morning, the patient, a homeless man in his 60s, lumbered into one of our exam rooms, slipped off the running shoes he wore like bedroom slippers and gingerly lifted his swollen legs so we could remove the medicated bandages and examine the raw wounds on his inner ankles.

docs.lead_paragraph: India spends more on programs for the poor than most developing countries, but it has failed to eradicate poverty because of widespread corruption, the World Bank said.

docs.lead_paragraph: To draw attention to the plight of immigrants, the conceptual artist Tania Bruguera is sharing a tiny Queens apartment with 11 other people and scraping by on the minimum wage.

docs.lead_paragraph: There are two obvious ways to look at the firestorm that greeted Newt Gingrich’s criticisms of the Ryan budget, and the humiliating walkback that quickly followed. From one perspective, it’s a sign that Gingrich is hopelessly out-of-touch with his own party’s newfound seriousness about tackling entitlements. Thus Pete Wehner:

headline.main: The Lessons of Gingrich v. Ryan

docs.abstract: The Ryan budget deserves criticism — but not the kind that Newt Gingrich offered.

docs.lead_paragraph: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago.

headline.main: Digging Deeper Into What Caused Job Losses

docs.abstract: Neither payroll-cutting by employers nor weak demand explain fully the job losses brought on by the Great Recession, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: While driving recently along the Ventura Freeway in Los Angeles, I watched a driver drift across traffic and settle at the shoulder of the road. Other drivers pulled over, exited their vehicles and began slapping the car’s windows in an effort to arouse the motorist, who was slumped over the wheel. I do not know the driver’s fate, as I was traveling in the leftmost lane.
